summary: In-depth 20+ years of expertise in teaching and scientific researches in the area of Artificial Intelligence and its applications, including automated reasoning, knowledge representation, Semantic Web technologies, intelligent support of decision making, human-computer interaction, assistive software technologies for people with special needs. Experienced as a team leader and member of the various international research and educational projects. Result-driven, strong analytic skills, focused on problem-solving, a team player with critical thinking and good communication skills. An author and co-author of more than 60 research papers, 7 patents and 12 university courses.

projects.title: Conference on Creativity in Intelligent Technologies &  Data Science
projects.description:
Creativity is the process of breaking out of established patterns; its the reorganization, recombination or reinterpretation of concepts and ideas for getting something unique and previously unknown. Creating software and intelligent technology is one of the most creative activities that humans undertake. It is developed for people and by people and peoples creativity can be a good source to improvise solutions to problems for dominating complex systems such as software design and development. Data Science is a new and breakthrough domain constructing business oriented software solutions based on data and using creativity. 

The volume contains proceedings of the Conference on Creativity in Intelligent Technologies \​& Data Science 2015 (CIT\​&DS 2015). The main objective of the CIT\​&DS 2015 is to bring together researchers and practitioners to share ideas in using creativity to theory and practice in software engineering, building intelligent technology and data science. The conference is dedicated to our scientific supervisor Professor Valery Kamaev who is an outstanding and remarkable person in science and life.

The conference on Creativity in Intelligent Technologies & Data Science 2015 has been supported by the Russian Foundation for Basic Research,  grant No.15-07-20700.

projects.title: RFBR Project 13-07-00219 Intelligent support of strategic planning based on integration of cognitive and ontological models
RamWass EU Project  037081 Integrated decision support system for risk assessment and management of the water-sediment-soil system at river basin scale in fluvial ecosystems
projects.description:
Decision making in river floodplain management is a complex process that involves many stakeholders and experts. Since stakeholders and experts often purpose mutually exclusive objectives and are often geographically distributed, decision making process takes a long time and not as optimal as it should be. Use of intelligent decision support system (IDSS) allows to decrease the time for decision making and to improve the quality and efficiency of decisions.
In this work we present the knowledge-based system for intelligent support of decision making in river floodplain management. This system integrates the case based reasoning (CBR), qualitative reasoning (QR) and ontological knowledge base. Proposed the case representation model is formally represented by the OWL DL ontology. For this model we give the descriptions of case retrieval, adaptation and revising algorithms that  accordingly to the initial tests perform better in the chosen domain then the known prototypes. Designed and implemented CBR-based IDSS for river floodplain management use object-oriented analysis and Java2 technology.

projects.title: RFBR Project 05-08-17930 Intelligent Support of Engineering Analysis Based on Ontologies, Qualitative Reasoning and Case-Based Reasoning
projects.description:
According to the results of decision-making process analysis the types of knowledge which must be represented within the knowledge representation model have been determined. Upon the comparative analysis formal ontologies have been selected as the knowledge representation model type. Mechanisms have been designed to represent the required knowledge field elements listed above using the modeling primitives available within the selected model type – concepts, roles, individuals. These mechanisms are based on introduction of concepts and roles with predefined semantics. Knowledge representation model has been developed which comprises: 1) ontology of mechanisms; 2) ontology of contact problems; 3) ontology of solution techniques; 4) special roles which relate concepts and individuals from the ontologies; 5) special concepts, which represent rules and constraints of engineering problems, contact problems and solutions. These ontologies are formally described with OWL-DL. 
The following algorithms were developed to operate on the suggested domain model in the framework of the selected reasoning mechanisms (CBR and QR) implementation:1) main case-based reasoning algorithms: case retrieval algorithms; ‘ontology-based’ retrieval algorithm; ‘graph-based’ retrieval algorithm; CBS-based algorithm; case adaptation algorithm; 2) support algorithms. 
The prototype of the automated system for intelligent support of solving problems with FEM related to contact mechanics (Intelligent Support of Finite Elements Analysis, jISFEA) is designed using object-oriented analysis and design technologies and UML modeling language.

projects.title: Tempus Gemeinsames Europäisches Projekt "Bachelor-/Master-Studium in Umwelttechnik" JEP_26211_2005
projects.description:
Spezifische Ziele des Projekts:
• 1. Gestaltung und Aufbau des erforderlichen Curriculums sowie Erstellung der Lehrpläne für die B-/MStudiengänge
• 2. Bedarfsorientierte Fort-/Weiterbildung zukünftiger Dozenten des B-/M-Studiums
• 3. Aufbau der Praktika sowie Bereitstellung der Räume und PC-Arbeitsplätze zur Durchführung des
Studienbetriebes
• 4. Erstellung eigener Lehrmaterialien sowie Beschaffung von Fachbüchern und weiterer Lehrmittel für die
Bachelor-/Master-Studiengänge in Umwelttechnik
• 5. Beginn des konsekutiven B-/M-Studiums an VolSU und des Master-Studiums an WolgGASU nach
Genehmigung der Lehrpläne durch die Hochschulen

profile_positions.description:
Research activity. 
- As a head and a member of research groups carried out 5 research projects in the areas of intelligent decision making and knowledge engineering. Created and headed the "Intelligence Technologies in Information Retrieval and Human-Computer Interaction" research group.
- 5 DAAD research fellowships in Leibniz University Hannover (2000, 2002, 2004, 2006, 2008).
- PC Member and Reviewer of papers for conferences JCKBSE 2014, CIT&DS 2015, 2017, IISA 2015-2018. 
- Volume editor of "Communications in Computer and Information Science", Springer, volume 466, 2014, volume 535, 2015, volume 754, 2017.
- Authored more than 30 papers listed in Scopus and Web of Science and 60 listed in Russian SCI.
- Developed the intelligent decision-making methods, knowledge representation models and intelligent decision support systems in various domains (engineering analysis, water management, waste management, human resource management, learning management).
- Developed the assistive software technologies, services and mobile applications for people with intellectual and developmental disabilities.
- Participated in international activities and various international research and educational projects.
Teaching activity.
- Supervised and co-promoted 6 Ph.D. students (promoted in 2006, 2011, 2013, 2014), 20 master students and a plenty of bachelors.
- Developed the curriculum and courses in "Artificial Intelligence", "Knowledge-Based Systems", "Knowledge Engineering", "Intelligent Decision Making", "Applied System Analysis".
profile_positions.title: Associate Professor

profile_positions.description:
- 5 DAAD research fellowships (2000, 2002, 2004, 2006, 2008) in the area of intelligent support of finite element analysis and water management under supervising Prof. P. Wriggers.
- Participated in EU Project RAMWASS (development of intelligent decision support system in Elbe river floodplain management).
